workflow.name: Automated execution cleanup system with n8n API and custom retention rules
workflow.description:
Make your n8n instance faster, cleaner, and more efficient by deleting old workflow executions ‚Äî while keeping only the most recent ones you actually need. Whether you're using n8n Cloud or self-hosted, this lightweight workflow helps reduce database/storage usage and improves UI responsiveness, using only official n8n nodes.

## üîç Description
Automatically clean up old executions in your n8n instance using only official nodes ‚Äî no external database queries required. Whether you're on the Cloud version or running self-hosted, this workflow helps you optimize performance and keep your instance tidy by maintaining only the most recent executions per workflow.

Ideal for users managing dozens or hundreds of workflows, this solution reduces storage usage and improves the responsiveness of the n8n UI, especially in environments where execution logs can accumulate quickly.

‚úÖ What It Does
* Retrieves up to 250 recent executions across all workflows
* Groups executions by workflow
* Keeps only the most recent N executions per workflow (value  is configurable)
* Deletes all older executions (regardless of their status: success, error, etc.)
* Works entirely with native n8n nodes ‚Äî no external database access required
* Optionally: set the number of executions to keep as 0 to delete all past executions from your instance in a single run

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Set Up
üîë‚ÄÇCreate a Personal API Key in your n8n instance:
Go to Settings ‚Üí API Keys ‚Üí Create a new key

üîß‚ÄÇCreate a new n8n API Credential (used by both nodes):
In your n8n credentials panel:

Name: anything you like (e.g., ‚ÄúInternal API Access‚Äù)

API Key: paste the Personal API Key you just created

Base URL: your full n8n instance URL with the /api/v1 path, e.g.
https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1

‚úÖ‚ÄÇUse this credential in both:

The Get Many Executions node (to fetch recent executions)

The Delete Many Executions node (to remove outdated executions)

üß©‚ÄÇIn the ‚ÄúSet Executions to Keep‚Äù node:

Edit the variable executionsToKeep and set the number of most recent executions to retain per workflow (e.g. 10)

Tip: Set it to 0 to delete all executions

üì¶‚ÄÇNote: The ‚ÄúGet Many Executions‚Äù node will retrieve up to 250 executions per run ‚Äî this is the maximum allowed by the n8n API.

üß†‚ÄÇNo further setup is required ‚Äî the filtering and grouping logic is handled inside the Code Node automatically.


## üß™ Included Nodes Overview
üïí Schedule Trigger ‚Üí Set to run daily, weekly, etc.

üì• Get Many Executions ‚Üí Fetches past executions via n8n API

üõ†Ô∏è Set Executions to Keep ‚Üí Set how many recent ones to keep

üß† Code Node ‚Üí Filters out executions to delete per workflow

üóëÔ∏è Delete Executions ‚Üí Deletes outdated executions

## üí° Why Use This?
Reduce clutter and improve performance in your n8n instance

Maintain execution logs only when they‚Äôre useful

Avoid bloating your storage or database with obsolete data

Compatible with both n8n Cloud and self-hosted setups

Uses only official, supported n8n nodes ‚Äî no SQL, no extra setup

üîí This workflow modifies and deletes execution data. Always review and test it first on a staging instance or on a limited set of workflows before using it in production.

parameters.content:
# üßπ Automatically Clean Up Old Executions in n8n (Keep Only the Most Recent Per Workflow)
Make your n8n instance faster, cleaner, and more efficient by deleting old workflow executions ‚Äî while keeping only the most recent ones you actually need. Whether you're using n8n Cloud or self-hosted, this lightweight workflow helps reduce database/storage usage and improves UI responsiveness, using only official n8n nodes.

## üîç Description
Automatically clean up old executions in your n8n instance using only official nodes ‚Äî no external database queries required. Whether you're on the Cloud version or running self-hosted, this workflow helps you optimize performance and keep your instance tidy by maintaining only the most recent executions per workflow.

Ideal for users managing dozens or hundreds of workflows, this solution reduces storage usage and improves the responsiveness of the n8n UI, especially in environments where execution logs can accumulate quickly.

‚úÖ What It Does
* Retrieves up to 250 recent executions across all workflows
* Groups executions by workflow
* Keeps only the most recent N executions per workflow (value  is configurable)
* Deletes all older executions (regardless of their status: success, error, etc.)
* Works entirely with native n8n nodes ‚Äî no external database access required
* Optionally: set the number of executions to keep as 0 to delete all past executions from your instance in a single run

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Set Up
üîë‚ÄÇCreate a Personal API Key in your n8n instance:
Go to Settings ‚Üí API Keys ‚Üí Create a new key

üîß‚ÄÇCreate a new n8n API Credential (used by both nodes):
In your n8n credentials panel:

Name: anything you like (e.g., ‚ÄúInternal API Access‚Äù)

API Key: paste the Personal API Key you just created

Base URL: your full n8n instance URL with the /api/v1 path, e.g.
https://your-n8n-instance.com/api/v1

‚úÖ‚ÄÇUse this credential in both:

The Get Many Executions node (to fetch recent executions)

The Delete Many Executions node (to remove outdated executions)

üß©‚ÄÇIn the ‚ÄúSet Executions to Keep‚Äù node:

Edit the variable executionsToKeep and set the number of most recent executions to retain per workflow (e.g. 10)

Tip: Set it to 0 to delete all executions

üì¶‚ÄÇNote: The ‚ÄúGet Many Executions‚Äù node will retrieve up to 250 executions per run ‚Äî this is the maximum allowed by the n8n API.

üß†‚ÄÇNo further setup is required ‚Äî the filtering and grouping logic is handled inside the Code Node automatically.


## üß™ Included Nodes Overview
üïí Schedule Trigger ‚Üí Set to run daily, weekly, etc.

üì• Get Many Executions ‚Üí Fetches past executions via n8n API

üõ†Ô∏è Set Executions to Keep ‚Üí Set how many recent ones to keep

üß† Code Node ‚Üí Filters out executions to delete per workflow

üóëÔ∏è Delete Executions ‚Üí Deletes outdated executions

## üí° Why Use This?
Reduce clutter and improve performance in your n8n instance

Maintain execution logs only when they‚Äôre useful

Avoid bloating your storage or database with obsolete data

Compatible with both n8n Cloud and self-hosted setups

Uses only official, supported n8n nodes ‚Äî no SQL, no extra setup

üîí This workflow modifies and deletes execution data. Always review and test it first on a staging instance or on a limited set of workflows before using it in production.

# üïí Schedule Trigger
This node defines how often the cleanup workflow should run. You can schedule it to execute daily, weekly, or at any custom interval.
[to learn more about Schedule Trigger node see the documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.scheduletrigger/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.scheduleTrigger)

# üì• Get Many Executions
Fetches up to 250 of the most recent executions from your n8n instance. It includes data like workflow ID, execution status, and timestamps.
[to learn more about Get Many Executions node see the documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.n8n/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.n8n#get-many-executions)

# üõ†Ô∏è Set Executions to Keep
This node defines how many of the most recent executions per workflow should be kept. You can easily adjust the executionsToKeep variable ‚Äî set it to 10, 5, or 0 to delete all.
[to learn more about Set node see the documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.set/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.set)

# üß† Code Node (Filter Executions to Delete)
This node processes the list of executions, groups them by workflow ID, sorts each group by most recent first, and filters out the oldest executions beyond the number you want to keep. Running executions are automatically excluded.
[o learn more about Code node see the documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.code/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.code)

# üóëÔ∏è Delete Many Executions
Deletes the selected executions using the official n8n API. It works in bulk and uses the same API credential as the "Get Many Executions" node.
[to learn more about Delete Executions node see the documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.n8n/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.n8n#delete-execution)
# ‚ùó This workflow deletes data. Always test in staging before enabling in production.

user.name: Arlin Perez
user.bio:

‚öôÔ∏è I'm passionate about automation and love building efficient workflows using n8n.
üì¨ Reach out  for any help with custom workflows
